pros: Most of the people were great to work with.

job_title: Adjunct Accounting Professor in Sheboygan, WI
pros: The University has provided a variety of experience in teaching in an online environment. I enjoy the experience of the connection I make with my students to promote their success in the program. I enjoy working at Lakeland University
cons: I would like to obtain an associate professor position. It seems that there is no promotions from adjunct professor positions.

pros: The students are good to work with.
cons: The faculty can be aloof and hard to work with.

job_title: Human Resources Generalist in Plymouth, WI
pros: Tuition Remission; Tuition Exchange; Work/Life Balance
cons: Pay range is low compared to other Universities

pros: Nice and friendly people. Many instructors and staff have decades  of experience at Lakeland and love this organization.  Low cost of living in the area.  Co-op program is growing and allows students to work while studying.  IT group is food and is offering students with options to attend  classes from home using video technology.  Good work-life balance as staff and faculty get plenty of flexibility.
cons: Wisconsin is not for everyone. Rural area an hour away from a big city (Milwaukee). Organization is extremely traditional and you would often hear "this is how we have been doing it here and how we will continue to do it". Students are not of high quality possibly because of low admission requirements. Lack of support for research and professional development.  Avoid if you are coming from a big city or from outside Wisconsin and care for good food and/or culture.  Lack of diversity.  Very small organization where people gossip all day and you have no privacy.  Level of classes is low as keeping students sometimes feels more important than maintaining decent level of pedagogy.  Compensation is significantly lower than national averages. Benefit package for employees is limited and non-competitive.

review_title: No chance to choose your book, learn class opening at the last minute and students want As when they don't deserve them
pros:
Good and convenient location
International students smart and hard workers
Blackboard system works fine, even if it could be better, but might improve in new versions
cons:
Team considering teachers as blue collar workers or meatballs
US students are arrogant for their level and systematically expect As to keep strangely high GPA always close to 4.0. Far from perfect, they are often of way lower level than foreign students and more demanding, real pains...
Classes are awarded at the last minute and adjuncts have no say in choosing the books of the class, usually very bad and out of reach for the level of Lakeland students. Besides, pre-class preparation is in consequence reduced to almost zero. 
Way too much time commitment for the pay!

job_title: Assistant Baseball Coach in Sheboygan, WI
pros: Great People, Family Atmosphere, Nice campus
cons: Not a place to be if you're a coach.  The school has no sense of what it takes to build and run successful athletic programs (Not an athletic minded school).   No money for assistant coaches (I was deemed part time but worked every bit of 50 plus hours a week for years and was told I'd never receive any type of financial help.)

job_title: Adult Education Instructor in Valders, WI
pros: Lakeland is an excellent college to work for.  The support staff is excellent and very helpful if you have any questions or problems to resolve.
cons: I do not have any cons to report.  The staff does an excellent job on helping the instructor achieve the goals and objects of the college.

pros: Excellent staff and faculty.  Very accommodating and gently show you the ropes with all the new technology that's appearing in modern classrooms.
cons: Location is near heavy construction on the freeway, so it's a bit toughto get there.

pros: The interaction with every student and meeting new people every day was a thrill.  It taught me different social lessons daily!
cons: Mainly the hours and compensation being that it was a on campus job I really did not worry about it.

pros: People, Flexibility, Feel valued, LU is innovative, Etc.
cons: I don't have any cons. Lakeland is a great place to work!

pros: Family atmosphere whe estimating helps each other.
cons: Not much else in the immediate area to do.

pros: Laid back atmosphere, family friendly, great education benefits.
cons: Not a lot of room for advancement.
